content:
User: No pip.exe

Gemini: Here's how:

Open File Explorer.

Navigate to the main Google Cloud SDK installation directory:

C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Cloud SDK\google-cloud-sdk\
In the Search box in the top right corner of File Explorer, type:

pip.exe
and press Enter. Windows will now search for pip.exe within the google-cloud-sdk directory and all its subdirectories.

Wait for the search to complete.

Examine the search results.

Does the search find any files named pip.exe?
If it finds pip.exe, please tell me the full path to where it is located. For example, it might be something like C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Cloud SDK\google-cloud-sdk\bin\pip.exe or in some other subdirectory.
Please let me know the results of this search. Did it find pip.exe, and if so, what is the full path to it?

Once we locate pip.exe, we can add that directory (the one containing pip.exe) to your PATH environment variable, and hopefully, we'll finally get pip working!
